{
  "article_text": [
    "by using the openmx code@xcite , we have performed fully - relativistic first - principles band structure calculations based on the density functional theory ( dft ) within the local density approximation ( lda)@xcite . fully relativistic pseudopotentials including spin - orbit coupling are generated by the morrison - bylander - kleinman scheme@xcite , which includes a partial core correction@xcite .",
    "the wave functions were expanded in a linear combination of multiple pseudo - atomic orbitals ( lcpao ) generated by a confinement scheme@xcite .",
    "pseudoatomic orbitals are chosen to be la8.0-@xmath1003@xmath1013@xmath1021@xmath1031 , ir7.0-@xmath1003@xmath1013@xmath1022 , and o5.0-@xmath1003@xmath1013@xmath1021 . the numbers after the chemical symbol ( 8.0 , 7.0 , 5.0 ) are the cutoff radii ( bohr ) , while the latter parts of the expansion ( e.g. , @xmath1003@xmath1013@xmath1021@xmath1031 etc . )",
    "are the number of orbitals for the @xmath100 , @xmath101 , @xmath102 and @xmath103 characters .",
    "we adopted the cutoff energy 250 ry which was used in the calculation of matrix elements associated with the difference charge coulomb potential and the exchange - correlation potential , and in solving poisson s equation using fast fourier transform ( fft ) .",
    "we include spin - orbit coupling as the second variation after convergence of the scalar - relativistic self - consistent - field ( scf ) , i.e. , we diagonalize the hamiltonian matrix including spin - orbit interaction constructed from scalar - relativistic eigenstates and wavefunctions@xcite .",
    "we use perdew - zunger expression for exchange and correlation energy@xcite .",
    "the @xmath104-space integration is achieved by the improved tetrahedron method@xcite . for the face",
    "centered cubic cell , a ( 4,4,4 ) mesh is used during the scf loops with 8 @xmath105 point in the irreducible brillouin zone ( ibz ) .",
    "muffin - tin spheres radii assumed are 1.0   for la , 1.1   for ir , and 0.8   for o. core states of 1@xmath100 to 4@xmath106 for la , 5@xmath107 for ir , 1@xmath108 for o fully relaxed by using the spherical part of the one - electron potential during the scf iterations .",
    "the energy cutoff of plane waves used is 25 ry .",
    "the charge density and potential are expanded using the cutoff of 100 ry .",
    "in order to check the reliability of the pseudopotential , calculations were also done with the all - electron full - potential linearized augmented plane - wave ( flapw ) methods  @xcite with local density approximation ( lda ) including spin - orbit interaction .",
    "figure [ band_la_y ] shows comparison of the band structures of flapw methods ( hilapw code ) and openmx code , for ( a ) la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with the crystal parameters of pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and ( b ) y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with the relativistic spin - orbit interaction .",
    "the calculated band structures obtained with the openmx code show good agreements with those with the hilapw code .",
    "this gives a support for the reliability of the present pseudopotential calculations and convergence in pseudo - atomic orbitals .",
    "ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and ( b ) y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 .",
    "black lines are calculated by hilapw code .",
    "red lines are calculated by openmx code .",
    ", width=604 ]",
    "figure [ fig6 ] shows total - energy profile for la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 in terms of lattice constant @xmath20 and internal parameter @xmath8 for oxygen 48@xmath103 site .",
    "the calculated total - energy is lowest at the experimentally observed @xmath20 and @xmath8 for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> fully relativistic first - principles electronic structure calculations based on a noncollinear local spin density approximation ( lsda ) are performed for pyrochlore iridates y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> the all - in , all - out antiferromagnetic ( af ) order is stablized by the on - site coulomb repulsion @xmath2 in the lsda+@xmath3 scheme , with @xmath4  ev and 1.3  ev for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , respectively . af semimetals with and without weyl points and then a topologically trivial af insulator successively appear with further increasing @xmath3 . for @xmath5  </S>",
    "<S> ev , y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is a topologically trivial narrow - gap af insulator having an ordered local magnetic moment @xmath6/ir , while pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is barely a paramagnetic semimetal with electron and hole concentrations of @xmath7/ir , in overall agreements with experiments . with decreasing oxygen position parameter @xmath8 describing the trigonal compression of iro@xmath9 octahedra </S>",
    "<S> , pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is driven through a non - fermi - liquid semimetal having only an isolated fermi point of @xmath10 , showing a quadratic band touching , to a @xmath11 topological insulator .    </S>",
    "<S> pyrochlore iridates @xmath12ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite have attracted great interest for experimental observations of an itinerant chiral spin liquid  @xcite below 1.4  k and a possible underscreened kondo effect around 20  k for @xmath13=pr  @xcite , a finite - temperature transition from a semimetal to an antiferromagnetic ( af ) insulator for @xmath13=nd , sm , and eu and a mott insulator for a shorter ionic radius of @xmath14 gd , @xmath15 , lu and y  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> ir @xmath16 electrons are also advantageous for achieving topologically nontrivial states with and without electron correlations  @xcite , because of a large relativistic spin - orbit coupling comparable to an electron transfer and the onsite coulomb interaction @xmath3 , as experimentally verified in sr@xmath0iro@xmath17  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> theoretical proposals include a @xmath11 topological band insulator ( tbi )  @xcite and mott insulator  @xcite , a weyl semimetal and an axion insulator  @xcite accompanied by all - in , all - out magnetic order  @xcite , a rhombohedral @xmath11 tbi under the @xmath18 $ ] pressure  @xcite , and a non - fermi - liquid semimetal  @xcite associated with a quadratic band touching of electronic dispersions at the fermi level  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> however , understandings of the underlying detailed electronic structures from the first principles remain open to date .    </S>",
    "<S> one of the obstacles is that reliably treating localized rare - earth @xmath19 electrons at the @xmath13 site is unfeasible in first - principles calculations . </S>",
    "<S> calculations on y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 using crystal parameters for @xmath14 pr , nd , sm , and eu on the less correlated side may yield a discrepancy , because the ionic radius and thus the lattice constant @xmath20 is longer by 1 - 3@xmath21 in these materials than in y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> it is also crucial to understand the dependence of the electronic structure on the only two crystal structure parameters allowed for @xmath12ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , i.e. , the lattice constant @xmath20 and the oxygen position parameter @xmath8  @xcite , which vary with changing @xmath13 site elements . </S>",
    "<S> it has been argued that even in the least correlated material pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , the all - in , all - out af metal ( afm ) is stable within the local spin - density approximation ( lsda ) based on the linear muffin - tin orbital method ( lmto ) even for @xmath22  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> this sharply contrasts to the experimental finding that pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is a paramagnetic semimetal ( psm )  @xcite .            in this letter </S>",
    "<S> , we provide extensive fully relativistic lsda and lsda+@xmath3 electronic structure calculations on y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 ( @xmath8=0.335 , @xmath2310.106   )  @xcite and on la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with varying crystal parameters around the experimentally observed values ( @xmath8=0.330 , @xmath20=10.400  </S>",
    "<S>  )  @xcite for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> a transition from a psm to an all - in , all - out af semimetal ( afsm ) occurs at @xmath24 with @xmath4  ev and 1.3  ev for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , respectively ( fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phase_u ] ) , in contrast to the previous lmto results mentioned above  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> 24 weyl points  @xcite are observed at @xmath25 - 1.2  ev and 1.35 - 1.5  ev for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , respectively . with further increasing @xmath3 </S>",
    "<S> , the afsm turns into a topologically trivial af insulator ( afi ) . </S>",
    "<S> the afi state of y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with @xmath5  ev has an ordered local magnetic moment @xmath26/ir , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phase_u ]  ( b ) , in reasonable agreement with the neutron - scattering experiments .  @xcite ( the orbital and spin components are given by 0.29@xmath27 and 0.21@xmath27 , respectively . ) this value of @xmath3 is smaller than @xmath28  ev  @xcite in sr@xmath0iro@xmath17 , probably because the localized nature of ir @xmath16 electrons is pronounced by the layered structure in sr@xmath0iro@xmath17 . </S>",
    "<S> with the same value of @xmath29  ev , pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is located on the verge of the pm phase . </S>",
    "<S> ( see fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phase_u ]  ( a ) . ) </S>",
    "<S> the psm state for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 has a cuboidal electron fermi surface centered at the @xmath30 point and toric hole fermi surfaces around the @xmath31 points . with decreasing @xmath8 and thus increasing ir - o - ir bond angle from @xmath32 ( @xmath33 ) to @xmath34 ( @xmath35 ) </S>",
    "<S> , we observe a transition to a fermi - point semimetal hosting a quadratic band touching of two doubly degenerate bands which form @xmath10 at the fermi level . </S>",
    "<S> a further decrease in @xmath8 drives a level crossing of @xmath10 and @xmath36 , resulting in a @xmath11 topological insulator for @xmath37 .    </S>",
    "<S> the calculations have been performed by means of a fully - relativistic non - collinear spin density functional theory within the lsda and lsda+@xmath3 methods implemented in openmx code  @xcite , which is based on the norm - conserving pseudopotential and a linear combination of multiple pseudo - atomic orbitals . </S>",
    "<S> ( for computational details , see supplemental materials . ) </S>",
    "<S> we use ( 9,9,9 ) to ( 18,18,18 ) uniform @xmath38-point mesh . </S>",
    "<S> the pseudopotentials and pseudo - atomic orbitals are severely checked by comparison with the all - electron full - potential linearized augmented plane - wave ( flapw ) method  @xcite , so that our fully relativistic scheme is well compared to the flapw results in the lda with the spin - orbit interaction being treated in the second variation scheme . </S>",
    "<S> ( see fig .  </S>",
    "<S> s1 in supplemental materials . ) </S>",
    "<S> the total - energy calculation using openmx reveals a structural stability around @xmath39 and @xmath40 for la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 ( see supplemental materials ) , which are close to the experimental observations for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and justifies the la replacement as long as the low - temperature rare - earth magnetism is irrelevant above 1.5  k@xcite . </S>",
    "<S> thus , we henceforth replace pr with la for calculations on pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> we assume that the translational invariance is fully preserved , while the ordered magnetic moment directions have been fully relaxed during the calcuations without adding any energy barrier and converged to the all - in , all - out af structure in all the magnetically ordered cases shown below .    </S>",
    "<S> figure [ bands_lio_yio ] shows the band structure and atom projected density of states ( dos ) of ( a ) a narrow - gap afi obtained for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with the lsda+@xmath3 ( @xmath5  ev ) and ( b ) a psm obtained for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 with the lsda ( @xmath22 ) . </S>",
    "<S> the fermi level has been chosen to be @xmath41 . in both cases , the bands in </S>",
    "<S> @xmath42 $ ]  ev shown in the atom projected dos ( fig.[bands_lio_yio ] ) are mainly composed of anti - bonding states of ir @xmath16 and o1 ( @xmath43 ) @xmath44 electrons in iro@xmath9 octahedra . </S>",
    "<S> the energy windows @xmath45 $ ]  ev for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and @xmath46 $ ]  ev for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 are given by a crystal - field gap due to the iro@xmath9 octahedral coordination .    </S>",
    "<S> in this afi for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , the charge gap is suppressed by a proximity to the afwsm . </S>",
    "<S> figure  [ weyl ] shows an evolution of the electron dispersions around a weyl point with increasing @xmath3 from 1.2 to 1.3  ev . </S>",
    "<S> weyl points are confined to the @xmath30-@xmath47-@xmath31 and symmetry - related planes  @xcite by the magnetic space group symmetry @xmath48 if they exist . </S>",
    "<S> they indeed appear at @xmath49(0.44 , 0.44 , 0.35 ) and ( 0.46,0.46,0.41 ) for @xmath25  ev and 1.2  ev , respectively , and symmetry - related points , with their energy level being located about 35 and 24  mev higher than the fermi level , leaving electron and hole fermi surfaces associated with the concentration @xmath50  /@xmath51 . </S>",
    "<S> the weyl point shifts towards the @xmath31 point with increasing @xmath3 and eventually disappear at @xmath52  ev . </S>",
    "<S> this leaves an topologically trivial afsm with similar electron and hole fermi pockets . </S>",
    "<S> then , an indirect gap @xmath53  mev opens between the valence band top at the @xmath31 point and the conduction band bottom at the @xmath30 point for @xmath5  ev . </S>",
    "<S> it is likely that disorder effects localize thermally excited dilute carriers in this narrow - gap afi and inelastic scattering events beyond the lsda+@xmath3 shcheme give rise to the variable range hopping , as experimentally observed in y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite , as well as in nd@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite and eu@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1@xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> -@xmath47-@xmath31 plane for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , ( a ) in the afsm with @xmath54  ev , ( b ) around the afsm - afi boundary at @xmath55  ev , and ( c ) in the afi with @xmath5  ev.,width=340 ]    ir@xmath0o@xmath1 for the crystal structure of pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> , width=226 ]    the psm for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 contains a twofold degenerate cuboidal electron fermi surface around the @xmath30 point and twofold degenerate hole pockets around the @xmath31 points , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fermisurface ] . from the fermi volumes , </S>",
    "<S> both the electron and hole carrier numbers are given by @xmath56  /@xmath51 for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . from the hall coefficient @xmath57  @xmath51/c measured in pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite , the ratio of the electron and hole mobilities @xmath58 and </S>",
    "<S> @xmath59 is estimated to be a rather large value , @xmath60 , through @xmath61 with the electron charge @xmath62 .    </S>",
    "<S> ir@xmath0o@xmath1 : ( a ) the energy level @xmath63 and ( b ) the level difference @xmath64 , which changes the sign at the white solid line . @xmath65 : a 242 psm , @xmath66 : a 242 paramagnetic fermi - point semimetal ( pfpsm ) , @xmath67 : a 422 @xmath11 tbi , and @xmath68 : a 422 psm . </S>",
    "<S> the numbers 242 and 422 in the above represent those of the degeneracies of the three levels at the @xmath30 point around @xmath69 in the ascending order in energy.,width=340 ]    now we study the dependence of the electronic structures on @xmath20 and @xmath8 within a psm or a band insulator , as @xmath70 in pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 depends on the temperature , a hydrostatic pressure , and possibly the sample quality . </S>",
    "<S> figure  [ phasediagram ] shows the phase diagram of la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 obtained with @xmath22 . </S>",
    "<S> it contains four phases ; ( a ) a psm as obtained for pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , ( b ) a paramagnetic fermi - point semimetal ( pfpsm ) of two doubly degenerate quadratic bands touching at the @xmath30 point at @xmath71 from above and below , ( c ) a @xmath11 tbi , and ( d ) another psm with even smaller electron and hole fermi pockets than in pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> this evolution of the electronic structure is attributed to a change in the single - orbital / ir kramers degenerate states closest to @xmath71 , which form a closed manifold consisting of four doubly degenerate bands , as shown in figs .  </S>",
    "<S> [ bands ]  ( a ) to ( d ) , respectively . in particular , the key role </S>",
    "<S> is played by an energy level crossing of a twofold degenerate @xmath36 and a fourfold degenerate @xmath10 , as we show below . </S>",
    "<S> ( the degeneracy of the latter is protected by the cubic and time - reversal symmetry , while that of the former is only by the time - reversal . )    </S>",
    "<S> when @xmath72 , namely , in the upper part than a white solid line in the phase diagram ( fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ]  ( b ) ) , the energy levels at the @xmath30 point satisfy the relation @xmath73 , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ bands](a ) . with decreasing @xmath8 , </S>",
    "<S> @xmath74 becomes shallow below @xmath71 , as seen from the color map of fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ]  ( a ) . </S>",
    "<S> accordingly , both electron and hole fermi volumes shown for @xmath75 and @xmath40 in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fermisurface ] gradually decrease . </S>",
    "<S> this slight increase of @xmath74 appears to be due to a rapid increase of @xmath76 approaching @xmath74 and @xmath71 , as shown in the color map of fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ]  ( b ) . </S>",
    "<S> then , around @xmath77 , the electron fermi surface eventually shrinks into a single point , while the hole fermi surfaces disappear , yielding a psm hosting a single fermi point with @xmath78 , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ bands ]  ( b ) . </S>",
    "<S> this paramagnetic fermi - point semimetal ( pfpsm ) appears in a white region in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ]  ( a ) . </S>",
    "<S> ( to be precise , we obtained this solution for @xmath79 in the case of @xmath80 and for @xmath81 in the case of @xmath82 , as marked by green points in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ] . )     </S>",
    "<S> dependence of the band structure of la@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 : ( a ) ( @xmath83   , @xmath40 ) the same structure as pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , ( b ) ( @xmath83   , @xmath82 ) , ( c ) ( @xmath84   , @xmath82 ) , and ( d ) ( @xmath83   , @xmath35 ) . , width=302 ]    on the other hand , with decreasing @xmath8 below @xmath85 , @xmath76 becomes larger than @xmath74 in the lower part of the phase diagram than the white solid line ( fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ phasediagram ]  ( b ) ) . </S>",
    "<S> this yields a narrow - gap insulator around @xmath37 . </S>",
    "<S> ( to be precise , the insulating solution is found for @xmath82 in the case of @xmath84 and 9.9     and for @xmath86 in the case of @xmath83   , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ bands](c ) . ) </S>",
    "<S> this is actually a strong @xmath11 tbi with the @xmath11 topological indices  @xcite @xmath87 , which has been confirmed by directly calculating the parity eigenvalues of all the occupied states at the time - reversal invariant momenta . </S>",
    "<S> the same topological indices can also be obtained within the single - orbital manifold per ir near @xmath71 . within this manifold , </S>",
    "<S> the occupied states at the eight time - reversal invariant momenta take the following irreducible representations ; the fourfold degenerate @xmath10 , fourfold degenerate @xmath88 at @xmath89 and the two symmetry - related points , doubly degenerate @xmath90 and @xmath91 at a single @xmath31 point , e.g. , @xmath92 , and @xmath93 and @xmath94 at the three symmetry - related points . </S>",
    "<S> note that the @xmath11 topological indices do not altered by any level crossing , for instance , of @xmath76 and @xmath74 , observed in the above phase diagram . </S>",
    "<S> actually , the @xmath11 tbi is realized by simply gapping out the band dispersions around the fermi level , which certainly requires @xmath95 . with further decrease in @xmath8 down to 0.30 </S>",
    "<S> , we observe that bands cross the fermi level , leaving small electron and hole fermi pockets near the @xmath30 and @xmath31 points , respectively , for @xmath79 , as shown in fig [ bands](d ) . </S>",
    "<S> note that the @xmath11 tbi phase and the pfpsm phase may expand more if we employ a method which may improve the bandgap in lda calculations , such as modified becke - johnson exchange potential@xcite , hybrid functionals(e.g . , hse@xcite ) , and gw methods@xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> the psm solution obtained for the crystal parameters of pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 is clearly compatible with the experimental finding on the ordinary hall constant  @xcite , as we already discussed , if we assume that the mobility of the holes is an order of magnitude smaller than that of the electrons . in this scenario , </S>",
    "<S> shubnikov - de haas oscillations with a single lifshitz - konsevich oscillatory component , experimentally observed in pr@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite , should be ascribed to the electron - like carriers . </S>",
    "<S> it will be possible to reach the quadratic band touching pfpsm , if a compound with smaller @xmath8 is found . </S>",
    "<S> this state can be experimentally verified by a @xmath96-dependent hall resistivity  @xcite and an angle - resolved photoemission spectroscopy . </S>",
    "<S> the bulk energy gap in our cubic @xmath11 topological insulator phase can be as large as 20  mev , and is experimentally observable , although it is required to find a material with even smaller @xmath8 .    </S>",
    "<S> when we almost finished the work , we noticed recent preprints  @xcite on the lsda+dmft calculations for @xmath12ir@xmath0o@xmath1 , which show a direct first - order phase transition between the pm and an afi in the space of @xmath3 and the temperature . </S>",
    "<S> the stability of the paramagnetic state up to a moderate value of @xmath3 is consistent with our results . </S>",
    "<S> however , @xmath97 for the af order is much larger than in our current results , which washes out the afsm with or without weyl points in the weak - to - intermediate range of @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> the ordered local magnetic moment , @xmath98  @xcite or @xmath99  @xcite , for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1 and the charge gap , 0.3  ev for y@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite or 0.4 - 0.5  ev for nd@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite , are also overestimated in comparison with our current results which agree with experiments . </S>",
    "<S> note also that a recent angle - resolved photoemission spectroscopy measurement in the low - temperature all - in , all - out ordered state of nd@xmath0ir@xmath0o@xmath1  @xcite has revealed half the symmetrized direct energy gap of 50  mev at the @xmath31 point  @xcite , which is compatible with our results ( fig.3(c ) ) but not the lsda+dmft results  @xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> the authors thank s. nakatsuji , k. matsuhira , and y .- b . </S>",
